mn68:2.2: The texts vary in the names of the monks here. See Analayo’s note 165, p. 371 of Comparative Study of MN. Apparently only the PTS edition has Nandiya, so that’s probably a mistake.
mn68:4.2: Reading te va as in PTS. Here the Buddha switches from addressing the monks as a whole to addressing just Anuruddha and his friends, as indicated by the plural vocative anuruddhā as opposed to bhikkhave above.
